Text: Randys CalculationOriginal Message From Lohman TK Sent Friday January AM To Mulligan Amy Schoolcraft Darrell Subject FW Compression Gas FYI TK Original Message From Gay Randall L Sent Friday January AM To Lohman TK Subject RE Compression Gas tk we show we only actually scheduled in december Richardson is taking the rest in Januaty so we will be scheduling a day jan th thru the st If you have any questions give me a call Randy Original Message From Lohman TK Sent Thursday January PM To Gay Randall L Subject FW Compression Gas Randy Stephanie asked me to send this to you Is this correct with your records TK Original Message From Mulligan Amy Sent Thursday January AM To Lohman TK Subject Compression Gas For December we should have scheduled to ECS We Scheduled Therefore as of the end of December we still need to schedule an additional So far was scheduled for and will be scheduled for the rd I did not receive any official numbers this month as to how much we owed ENA for January so that still needs to be figured out I hope this is what you need Amy

Dec and Jan Compressor GasAttached are the spreadsheets which show the amount of gas which should be nominated as payment for electricity provided to the Gallup Compressor The amount nominated for Bisti is a constant mmbtuday each month Therefore the total daily amount for December was mmbtuday and the total for January was Thanks Amy

Calpine and Griffith VolumesAttached are the monthly volumes for Calpine and Griffith the average volume for Griffith may be hard to calculate because the plant has not yet gone commercial and the loads have been very inconsistent

RE ContinentalI left a message with Pam Stiegerwald Ill tell her she should move her gas otherwise itll be allocated Thanks Amy Original Message From Hanagriff Richard Sent Tuesday January AM To Schoolcraft Darrell Lokay Michelle McEvoy Christine Mulligan Amy Subject Continental day is being schedule at Wolf Creek and we are not receiving volume thus increasing Continentals imbalance Should we be allowing this volume to be scheduled

FW Griffith Testing Prior to Plant OutageOriginal Message From Kenneth G Gruhl ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESKennethGGruhlCkggruhldukeenergyEcomE NRONcom Sent Wednesday August PM To Mulligan Amy Allen K Nielsen Beck Mayberry Christopher S Smart Schoolcraft Darrell Darren Stephens David Bowers David P Pell George X Ouzounian James Stebbins Kim White Michael Kerr Michael Wells Sherry Davis Steven Fliflet Steven Fliflet Ted Romo Todd Hendricks Tom Carlson Tyler J Kristensen Cc Subject Griffith Testing Prior to Plant Outage We are now in the process of planning a total Griffith Plant Outage to fix equipment deficiencies Most likely start of Outage is on Sunday Aug earliest Saturday Duration of Plant Outage is approximately days We have been running very steady for the last couple of days However please be advised that prior to the outage various operational tests are being planned During this time MW output will be variable and difficult to schedule May I request your indulgence as we work through this phase Tomorrow morning the Startup Manager will produce a list of tests to be run prior to the outage As the Test Plan is developed I will keep everyone informed as much as possible

Eastern New Mexico Agent Cc Eastern New Mexico has terminated its agency agreement with Enron North America From now on Coral will be agent for their shipper contract Eastern New Mexico and Coral are still discussing what to do with Eastern New Mexicos OBA agreement but that will be settled before the end of the month If you need to get in contact with them for nomination and scheduling issues you can reach Susie Horton Coral at And for operational questions at their point or regarding their OBA imbalance you can reach Ricky Britain Eastern New Mexico at Thanks Amy

Updated Capacities West of Thoreau and San Juan Cc Darrell has updated the following capacities until further notice West of Thoreau has been increased from to San Juan has been increased from to Thanks Amy

Negotiated RatesAttached is the report I mentioned in printed form it shows each discount for each path for each contract I will mention this to the TW team now but go over the report in further detail on the first day of invoicing so each can see the discounts for their own shippers Hopefully this will reduce future PPAs Thanks Amy
TW Weekend Notes Cc Please see the attached notes

Citizens Agency Agreement at GriffithEffective August Enron Asset Management Resources will be acting as agent for the Citizens Communications Company at the Griffith interconnects on both Transwestern and El Paso I will be the primary scheduler in charge of communicating with the plant regarding its needs confirming the gas at both interconnects managing the OBAs and allocating flows to the owners of the plant In order to ensure a smooth transition I will probably be in close contact with each of you For the time being we will use the burn estimates which come from the plant to determine our confirmed volumes on Transwestern and El Paso as well as daily discussions we have with Duke PPL and our gas control In my absence the rest of the Transwestern scheduling team will be trained to do the daily confirmations and work with gas control with regard to daily flows Thank you for all your cooperation If you have any questions please feel free to call me Sincerely Amy Mulligan

Citizens Imbalance Cc Attached are the spreadsheets for September and October There is a measurement issue on Finalized TW measurement at the Interconnect shows Mmbtus whereas SCADA from Gas Control at the inlet to the plant shows a volume of Mmbtus therefore creating a difference of between the interconnect and the inlet to the plant Craig I dont know if you have a more accurate number or if we just want to go with the measured volume since I believe it to be the most accurate volume Please respond with your feedback on this issue Thank you Amy Mulligan

Griffith PlantThe Griffith plant is currently down and will probably be down for the rest of the month I have put a zero capacity in CAS for the deliveries through If it should come up for allocation please analyze whether it is due to flow rate As long as it schedules to zero we are fine you can ignore the flow rate The contracts which are currently scheduling there must be balanced at zero if we allocate because of a flow rate the system generates I may have to put on an imbalance the next morning in order to get the contracts to balance If you have any questions while allocating please ask me Thanks for your help in this matter Amy
Gas Sales Cc The Gas Sales out of the West TX pool have been nominated and confirmed the deals are to Reliants contract to Sempras contract If you have any questions just ask me Thanks Amy

New TW Points Cc Perry Frazier has set up the three new points in the CAS system and entered their capacities Agave Dodd mmbtu Agave Loco mmbtu NGPL Eddy mmbtu These are all receipt points and are ready to flow Thanks Amy
Griffith Imbalance as of Attached are the imbalances as of the th The plant will be down for approximately to days Thanks Amy Mulligan

Updating Capacities Cc After talking with Terry Darrell and the team the following procedures have been developed so that each team member is consistent and all pertinent information is properly documented Darrell is going to set the Socal Capacity in CAS to its Operational Capacity therefore from now on we should only update the Socal window in TMS and opt not to send the capacity from TMS to CAS when asked In addition we should continue to update the comments section in CAS each cycle for the Socal Window For all other points when updating Capacities in TMS the changed capacity should be sent to CAS only if it is a change in Operational Capacity If we are updating for any other reason flow rate etc those capacities should not be sent back to CAS In conclusion from now on we will only update capacities in TMS and we will only send changes to CAS or make changes in CAS if there is a change in Operational Capacity which will probably be a decision made by Darrell The Socal Capacity in CAS and online is however we will continue to document the Window in the CAS Comments and update it in TMS These procedures will be effective for the Timely of Gas Day If you have any questions please ask me Thanks
FW NBC Pictures of the Year NBC Pictures of the yearpptspps

EPNG Griffith Scheduling reports Cc I think I have finally decided what to do with these Lets keep all of these reports in a separate pile from the Blanco reports as long as there is no other downstream gas being scheduled ie Blanco or Window Rock In that case we will have to break the reports down by Point Number ie Griffith is on El Paso At the end of the gas day whe filing away reports please leave the Griffith reports on my desk I will file them away myself I wasnt quite sure how to deal with these but I have concluded that as EAMR agent for Citizens we should be keeping a separate file as this function If you have any questions please feel free to ask Thanks Amy
El Paso at Griffith Power Plant Cc On Transwestern for the th At the El Paso Interconnect with Citizens Mmbtus will be scheduled for the day If you have any questions please call me Thanks Amy
Griffith on El Paso The noms for the rd are and for the th are Darrell said we would flow tomorrows gas with todays nom and then not flow anything off El Paso tomorrow Thanks Amy
El Paso Griffith Cc The estimated scheduled volume from El Paso at the Griffith Interconnect for the rd will be Mmbtu If this number changes I will send you another email Thanks Amy

RE Gas SalesI spoke with Sarah with Richardson this morning the breakdown is actually Thanks Amy Original Message From Lohman TK Sent Wednesday October AM To Lohman TK Moore Jan Moseley Debbie Ward Linda Mulligan Amy Watson Kimberly Strohmeyer Vincent Walton Mark Subject RE Gas Sales The total sales volumes stays the same at mmbtu On October Richardson Products will only take mmbtu but on October Richardson will up their volumes to mmbtu Thanks TK Original Message From Lohman TK Sent Tuesday October PM To Moore Jan Moseley Debbie Ward Linda Mulligan Amy Watson Kimberly Strohmeyer Vincent Subject Gas Sales Sold mmbtuday for through at Gas Daily El Paso Permian Midpoint See attached confirmation File saledocTWxls
